Posts.Content: Talk to your doctor about prescribing something for you, a sleeping pill, if only temporary. If you aren't sleeping now, you need something to help you. You need your sleep! A simple sleeping pill is not going to hurt you..it will only help you to get the much deserved sleep your body craves and needs.

Posts.Title: My Chemo buddy lost ...

Posts.Content: I got burnt, like a bad sunburn. But, it went away after I finished radiation and I was left with a tan. This time, nothing so far, but, I am only starting. I am using a creme that they gave me even if I don't need it yet. I may try aloe vera. I have read on here and other sites that it is good. I need to check with the radiation oncologist first though. It seems a lot of things can interfere with the radiation.
Posts.Title: Radiation bad effects????

Posts.Content: But, I am getting tired already. I seem to need a lot of sleep, but, I don't sleep really well.
Posts.Title: Radiation bad effects????

Posts.Content: Those darn red bumps are itchy. I started scratching some of mine today and YIKES...It isn't good. I wish there was something else I could use. Any ideas? And, when does the itching go away??????????????
Posts.Title: Anyone else have itchy, red bumps during Radiation?

Posts.Content: When does the itching and the red bumps/spots go away? Hopefully, soon after the radiation ends. The itching is awful! Benadryl? Is that prescription creme?

Posts.Title: I Lost My Sister Today

Posts.Content: I never burnt as some did, but, got as close as you can probably get to it.  I was glad when the boosters started as the rest started to feel and look better quickly.  I used so much Aquaphor that my hubby joked that I should have bought stock in it.  lol My rads onco saw me at least twice a week to check my skin.  I know sometimes they have to stop rads if you are burning too badly and give your skin a break, but, I don't know if it happens frequently.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: What helped you during radiation?

Posts.Content: Whenever I read of a sister having chemo, I am so amazed by their strength and perseverance. I never had chemo, just rads, but, know that it has to be so hard. I wish you the best and hope that you will soon be done and we can all celebrate that huge milestone with you.

Posts.Title: came back high risk

Posts.Content: I met with my oncologist, as all of the rest of my team of doctors on the same day before anything was done. The plastic surgeon wanted to explain the lumpectomy and the oncologist wanted to explain my whole treatment plan, contingent upon the pathology report. The oncologist is your main doctor forever after you have cancer. Kristin ♥

Posts.Title: More "Positive News" - Monthly onc visit & Zometa Infusetion

Posts.Content: I was just wondering, when is it time to quit posting on here? When is it time to move on? Is there a certain time to move on? Is it after our treatments are finished? Is it 1 to 5 years after our NED news? Or does the site, or, has the site become too much of a comfort blanket to us? A place where any of us can come anytime of the day or night for a laugh, a cry, to vent or just to read what other bc survivors are doing. Or, is it because of the cyber friends we have met on here? The ones that we connected with and plan on always staying in touch with? Or, is it when we go back to work and can't find the time to be here? When is it time???????????????????? Kristin ♥

Posts.Title: RECONSTUCTION RE IS HAVING HOPEFULLY ONE FINAL SURGERY

Posts.Content: Take your Mother to the emergency room or whatever is open as soon as possible. I have no idea what it might be, but, that is what Doctor's are for. And, it always best to have anything that you feel is new checked out. Good luck!
Posts.Title: question about my mom

Posts.Content: Hi Stubbrn and Welcome! Having bc and all of the treatments and tests that follow can be overwhelming for everyone. But, you will get thru it, as, we all have and still are going thru various treatments. As far as HER2 -, it is best to talk to your oncologist as to what that means and how it will affect you. I am HER2 +, so, I can't answer about what it means. I do wish you the best of luck! Please post and keep us updated on yourself! Hugs, Kristin
Posts.Title: New to this

Posts.Content: I have been reading up on tamoxifen on the internet. It doesn't sound too bad. And, if it helps in a recurrence of cancer..the side effects, I guess, are the least of our concern. Right?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen..How did everyone do on it??

Posts.Content: I really never thought twice about having rads, as, I knew that I wanted all of those pesky cancer cells burnt, killed, gone forever. You must weigh your options and make an informative choice based on what your gut says. ♥ Kristin ♥
Posts.Title: Surgery, Radiation, and Frustration

Posts.Content: It is next to impossible to ever get Coumadin adjusted. For some reason, you have to keep changing it all of the time. Not a good thing, but, something that just has to be done. I have never known anyone to just get on it, and, not have to keep changing and readjusting it. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Blood clot in leg - anyone have one?

Posts.Content: I am supposed to take it for 5 years after I finish my radiation treatments. I am dreading the side effects. I have never had a hot flash and they talk about vaginal discharge, weight gain? Dang, anything else?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen..How did everyone do on it??

Posts.Content: Hi Barb. I can't answer you about reconstruction, as, I had a lumpectomy. But, I don't think you are overreacting. I think you should call your doctor and talk to him and get the MRI if it will help you to feel better. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Normal for changes in reconstructed breast?

Posts.Content: NED is a good word to hear! Congratulations!
Posts.Title: Good to Go for Another Six Months

Posts.Content: I am also praying that each and every one of us have a Happy and Healthy New Year! Kristin ♥
Posts.Title: I Just Want To Wish All Of You A Very Healthy & Happy New Year!

Posts.Content: I still have some pain in the breast that I had the lumpectomy on and the radiation. It hurts but not unbearable, just like someone said here, like a shooting pain every now and then. I told my radiation oncologist and my oncologist about it and they both said it was very normal. I am still healing and this is just part of that process. But, always check with your doctor's if you notice something new or are concerned.
Posts.Title: Pain in Breast

Posts.Content: I am wishing to all of you a very Happy New Year! I pray that we all have good health! Kristin ♥
Posts.Title: I Just Want To Wish All Of You A Very Healthy & Happy New Year!
